Fish or chicken? 11 examples of disgusting food from aircraft
05 Nov 2019, 15:45 by Daria Gromova
A selection for those who are not afraid to lose their appetite.
Edition Which? Travel annually holds a kind of ‚Äúcontest‚Äù among readers on a photo of the worst dishes they received on airplanes. It has already published the infernal menu of 2019: from chicken "slurry" to stone cake, served at an altitude of 10 thousand meters. It should be noted that not all dishes are from economy class: business is also not sinless.
Breakfast



A Ryanair passenger made a terrible mistake and ordered an Irish breakfast. The option was taught as "the best way to start your day" - apparently, this meant starvation. The dish consists of wet potato waffles, shriveled mushrooms and a frozen white pudding. Earlier, readers called Ryanair the worst airline in general - and food only confirms this status.



Another unpleasant morning surprise - but from the Indian SpiceJet. The author of the photo says ‚ÄúIt was supposed to be an omelet, grilled sausages and a hash brown. It tastes about the same as it looks. ‚Äù



British Airways has proven that it‚Äôs just as difficult to cook and serve eggs at 10,600 meters as it is on earth.
Slop on top



A Norwegian Airlines passenger was extremely surprised to see chicken and mashed potatoes literally floating in oil in her lunch. Turkey ham and Swiss cheese baguette were no better: it looked something like this.



In business class, too, is not without sin



Until now, the photos were from passengers flying in economy - but this does not mean that overpaying for the class above will automatically guarantee you a good lunch. For example, a dish from the board of British Airways. A piece of dried chicken, burnt cauliflower, a spoonful of some slurry and overcooked rice.



And here is what he was offered on the way back: this, according to the local cook, looks like an omelet.



It seems that this carrier has generally problems with "improved" nutrition. Here is another example: mashed potatoes for some reason have a hard crust around the edges, and the vegetables are overcooked and have lost all taste.



This BA passenger was also unlucky: steaks and chicken ran out, while the stewardess got to him, there was only cheese paste. The pasta turned out to be cold, and the cheese hardened, so eating more than one fork did not work.
Brick cake



And here is what Etihad serves on a flight from Bangkok to Abu Dhabi. Corn, beans and rice were cold and without any seasoning, and the cake was so dry and hard that it looked more like a brick than a dessert.
Special menu



Ordinary passengers, as a rule, don‚Äôt have so much choice, and those who need a special menu usually don‚Äôt have it at all. Here's the kosher menu that a passenger ordered in advance at British Airways. Dry cod and tasteless vegetables did not please the passenger at all: according to him, each piece of fish had to be supplemented with spinach so that it could be eaten somehow.
Have you encountered disgusting food on planes? Tell us about it in the comments!
